text: I had been hearing such nice things from co-workers about Mint and anxiously awaited a free night with my husband.  Finally, last Saturday 12/2, we rsvp'd on the 'Mint' website for dinner.  We dressed up, drove  from Summerlin and headed over to Mint. Upon arrival we were greeted with a sign at the door indicating 'the restaurant was closed for a private event." This was so disappointing and we felt terribly inconvenienced as the Mint website didn't indicate they were closed.  It won't be anytime soon that we make the effort to return.

Pleasant surprise. Probably the best Indian restaurant in Las Vegas.Complicated menu but they do have a member of staff that has real culinary expertise to help with making the correct choices. The Indo Chinese menu has some excellent items on it too.

Personal Favorite Madras curry and burnt garlic fried rice with vegetables.

Enjoy!

This place is fantastic, we had an Indian pale ale that was soo good and the much buffet was amazing, thank you so much for the great food and the great atmosphere! Your employees are very attentive and nice!

Around the corner from us and I love Indian food so had to try it. Had no idea it has such a following from its east side location that they opened a second location on the west side due to popular demand!
Very nice interior, open and comfy. My husband and I tried the Chef's Tasting Menu as we have only eaten Indian food a few times (although I make a mean Tikka Masala at home).

The vegetable pakoda was amazing appetizer. Favorites from the tasting menu were: tikka masala, lamb vindaloo and tandoori chicken w/ yogurt. Their garlic naan bread is fantastic, definately needed a second order!

Oh, and they also have an inferno menu featuring ghost chili peppers. All I can say is YUMMY!

So as to not ruin my entire palate for the evening, I just ordered the Inferno Naan stuffed with paneer cheese. If you like heat, you will love this bread! Definately has alot of heat, but not debilitatingly hot. 

And a self-service beer and wine bar? How can you go wrong with that!

Been back a second time already with out-of-town guests, they really liked it too.
Definately making this a regular for our dinners out!
Flavor was good; however portion size was inadequate given the high price. Tikka masala entree with chicken and an order of naan was 20.00  although I liked the food, I won't be returning.
Ambience is great.Service is good.The  buffet  doesn't have more varieties for the price. The quantity of the food is less in alacarte and the taste is not much authentic.

Absolutely my favorite place to eat! I like this location because there's more space, with the same great food. Everything I've tried I love, the flavors make me do a happy dance in my seat... seriously. The self serve beer and wine bar is a fun thing to mess with, I really liked the selections I tried. It's really a great place with great food, I can't wait to go back!

This is my newest best Indian restaurant in town looking forward to many more meals here been open You have to try the chili chicken, also some of the best pakora in town. Great beer selection with self serve craft option

Delicious!!! 
I have only really had this type of food every so often, but I really enjoyed the taste here as well as the service. They were extremely polite and made sure we were taken care of.
I think what was impressive was at the end. They were closing in a few minutes and I watched as two different groups walked in to eat. Now I found that to be rude as I had been in the restaurant industry, but again polite and made sure to sit them down like no big deal. 
Excellent!

For the new location.
star's are for food only we have been and both locations over 10 times!

Service was a 3 
The flavor of the food is very delicious we went on a slow day no more then 6 tables.
Food took forever literally. 

Our server was rude! Not helpful! Cold!
I'm not Indian! Love the food had a Hard time remembering my favorite dishes. He basically said everything I was looking for was on this menu!
He favorite dish I did not like! It as sweet more for American palette The safe card.

The layout of the menu is overwhelming. Has all the information and more but very hard to read. 

Nann is available $3.50 per each order.
Make sure you order ahead while eating or you will stuck eating food without nann. Since it takes a long time and since the server's don't come by to ask you if you would like some more before you're completely done eating.

Went there today with friends. We've been there before and know that the lunch buffet is $15 per person. My mistake was that when I paid the bill, I did not realize that 18% gratuity was automatically added for four people. I left an additional $20 but that is my price for not paying attention. When I paid, the bill was presented to me with the portion to add the tip which is what I did. It wasn't until I got home and looked closely at the itemized bill that I noticed. Pay attention to your bill. I won't have to anymore because I will not be returning. 

And food was "meh."  Go to Curry Leaf instead. Much better service and food is more reasonable and better.
Great buffet and fresh Naan for lunch. Huge selection and full of flavor, worth the price. Have a pepper challenge if you dare... lol

This was my first experience with Indian food in Vegas and it was good but not amazing. The lamb samosas were yummy and I would definitely get those again. I also got the saag paneer and chicken tikka masala. The saag paneer was good but could have used some more flavor and same with the chicken tikka masala.. it was a little bland but none the less still enjoyable to eat. I also loved the naan, and rice portion that came with the dinners!

Huge restaurant.  Decorated lovely.  Tons of buffet choices.  Great food flavors.  Custom cooked naan is a nice touch.  The presentation of your receipt (you'll understand when you see it) was really nice.

Very good food. Contemporary setting.  Great selection of Beers.  Northern and Southern Indian food - all v.v. tasty.

This is one of the better Indian restaurants in the Vegas area.

Delicious food.  Great service.  High prices.  That is the only bit significant issue.  A nearby Indian restaurant shut down so hopefully they are doing well.  

The location and interior are perfect.  The vindaloo and butter chicken are so good.  I can't wait to try their buffet!

OMG! The food is just amazing! I love that they have so many Gluten free-Vegan options! The food is just hands down Amazing! and Julie!! She is so funny and just great customer service. They got a customer for life!

Grand Opening Attendee. I personally do not know the owner,  therefore this review is unbiased. I was a guest of their friends. 

This has got to be the coolest Indian spot! I love the tandoori ovens they have for baking naan. 

Delicious food. Excellent ambiance. Great selection of liquor. 

I was confused by the lassi bar, since lassi is a yogurt drink, but the wall had beer bottles displayed.


Now, you can be the coolest, fanciest restaurant, serving mouth watering food, but I am all about  customer service, if the customer service isn't there, I will not return to an establishment. Currently I cannot speak about that. Will update after future visits.

The food was yummy. You must be patient because everything is cooked to order.  We loved our meal and are anxious to go back for the lunch buffet.  
The owner will help you order if you are not sure what you would like.  So excited to have this wonderful restaurant in our neighborhood. 
We had the Shrimp Marsala & Chicken Vindaloo. My favorite veggies are the potatoes & cauliflower. Garlic Naan & Rice.  It's as good as any Indian restaurant I've been.  Will be back.
Ordered some takeout and got charged for rice I didn't order and didn't want. Portion of Saag Paneer was kinda small for the price and didn't come with naan. Not bad, but not impressed either.

Came to this location for the first time since dining at the East Flamingo location a few years ago. Benefits of this new location is that its super close to home and has a good amount of parking. Never been to this plaza before besides donating at Salvation Army haha ! 

We were sat at a table almost immediately upon arrival. The restaurant was mildly busy during the dinner time with a few occupied tables around. The layout of the restaurant is fairly open with booths lining the side and tables in the middle. There are more tables in the back corner but it seems like the area is closed off and maybe used during lunch time when they have the lunch buffet. 

Since its been quite a while since I've had indian food, I resorted to asking the waiter on recommendations. Otherwise, the only few things I knew was like mango lassi, butter chicken, tandoori chicken, and naan. Lol 

Mango Lassi - Lassi's are a cold, homemade yogurt or organic soy yogurt drink blended w/ choice of sugar, salt, or fresh mango pulp. wait sugar or salt? wt... how would that taste D: I don't think im curious enough to try it... BUT ANYWAY ! Mango lassi was nice and sweet. Very creamy and thick. Difficult to drink using a straw at first. Wish it was colder though. Would have been more satisfying. But still yummy nonetheless

Garlic Naan Makhani - I had wanted garlic naan, and this appetizer was recommended because it comes with a side of makhani sauce (butter chicken curry sauce w/o the chicken... haha) - Suggested to get this and a side of some more naan to share. Always been a fan of butter chicken so this is a good way to get the sauce. Kind of pricey for 1 naan cut to strips and 2 small cups of sauce but at least garlic naan itself is not bad, in terms of price, so you can finish off the sauce. 

The below 3 curries were ordered at a 7-8. Probably at about the same level as an 8 or so at Thai restaurants. Waiter had asked us what we ordered at Thai, and we said 10. So he suggested about 7. Maybe next time, we can up it a notch. Hope I didn't get this wrong, but iirc, he explained how North Indian cuisine is more creamy vs South Indian cuisine is more spicy. 

Saffron Cauliflower curry

Unfortunately, I think the saffron didn't come out that well in comparison to a seafood dish like a Spanish paella. The curry flavor was strong. Cauliflower was cooked well and not over cooked and soft. 

Mahakali Mango Marsala - Mango chunks cooked in an onion & fennel-seed base to create a sweet and spicy sensation revival to Maharaja Tikka Masala. 

Probably my favorite of the 3 curries. I'd never imagined a mango curry but this was really yummy. Mild sweetness from mango combined with the spice from the spices used. Yum yum ! !

Andhra Curry - a South Indian Specialty spicy curry flavored w/ coconut milk and spices from the state of Andhra Pradesh. 

Spiciest of the 3 but only by a little amount. Flavor is more strong in comparison but still delicious. Topped with a full piece of star anise, there are pods of star anise in the curry as well. Take caution ! 

All these curries were yummy with the complimentary rice or if you have any leftover naan, 

Seekh Lamb Kabob - Ground lamb spiced w/ mint and garam marsala baked on a skewer in a special clay oven (tandoori oven) 

Flavorful meat "rolls" served in a sizzling plate with onions and other veggies. Very minimal, if any, gamey flavor. My mom, who usually is pretty sensitive to gaminess said there wasn't much either. Flavorful, as said previously, but mildly dry. Was ordered by recommendation. We originally wanted the lamb chops, but opt'ed for this to try something new. 

Tandoori Chicken - Marinated over 24 hours in Chef's famous marinade then baked to perfection in special clay oven (tandoori oven) served sizzling

Juicy, tender pieces of chicken on the bone served on a sizzling plate with onions and other veggies. Preferred over the Seekh Kabob. I mean, how can you go wrong with tandoori chicken tho?

Overall. Great meal. Family loved it. We'd all return again for the same if not different stuff. They've been bugging me for quite a while to try indian and now they love it ! Maybe will try the lunch buffet some day too !

Excellent vegan and gluten free options. The lunch buffet offers at least 50% of the items as vegan and gf. The menu is well coded for v, gf and veg. The food tastes great and everyone is usually very friendly and helpful. They have a unique inferno challenge for those who like things extra spicy. They have a unique beer and wine "by the ounce" self serve option. Lovely decor and large dining area. On weekends they are open pretty late. I've been here at least 6 times over the last year and really enjoy it every time.

Food is great,very fresh and very clean.
There is a good verity even for vegan and that's awesome! Owner(I think is the owner) always there, guiding the team and point them what to fix sims like he is really care-that's probably the main reason why the food is great. I give 4 stars and not 5 only because we came at 2pm for the buffet and there wasn't  salad any more,only few left overs from the lettuce (not even for one person),
So if I pay $15 a person I am expecting to have it all.

Excellent, just had a British Party for about 35 of us. Food was very good.
Decor is nice, very new and spotlessly clean!
Good stocked bar, they were just not used to a large group hitting the bar at once!

Mint's new west side location is doing things right: with a buffet for lunch and a la carte and demo dinner options for evening, there's a lot more going on here than your typical Indian restaurant! 

BUFFET: Lunch buffet is solid, at $15 and several options including fresh garlic naan and multiple food stations. Their curries and kabob items are some of my favorites, but I always get the saag paneer if I see it. I like how this location has more appetizer type items than other buffets, rather than just several rice and curry dishes. Speaking of rice, their biryani is pretty bomb, too. Come hungry!

DINNER: They recently previewed a new Indo-Chinese menu with fusion items. You can reserve seating to be by the kabob or naan station for dinner and watch the cooks up close and personal. This menu is a la carte, dinner only, and very well executed. Favorites include the Drums of Heaven (chicken lollipops), Hariyali Paneer (SO GOOD!), and Spicy Chili Baby Corn (which doesn't even taste like corn!). Interacting with the chefs and watching the dishes be made makes for entertainment while you wait, and everything smells so good- you really work up an appetite!

Food quality is solid, service is attentive, and the new location is so nice! Bonus points for having several vegetarian dishes, and some available vegan. They even have milk alternatives for the lassi drinks so that they are available vegan as well!
Went to Mint for Valentine's Day. Very good experience from staff to food. Cool ambiance with a self serve wine and beer bar. Very reasonable prices. Overall great experience.

Amazing buffet lunch. I am part Indian, and have eaten at many Indian restaurants over the world, as well as home cooked food ~ this is very authentic food, the garlic naan bread is delish and the guulab jamin is sooo good. Very friendly and personable staff. If you like Indian food this is a must.

Food was great, portions were pretty small & service was horrible. Took 2 hours total from start to finish. Our entrees were brought out at separate times. Forgot one dish, forgot to bring to go box, but didn't forget to bring us the check. Would not recommend to a friend. Go to Curry Leaf instead, amazing & amazing service.

Honestly, I find this restaurant to be oddly laid out. I don't  get the beer/ wine concept at all. Why the 5 stars ? I've tried just about every Indian buffet in LV, mint is definitely top 3. The food is delicious and the service is above and beyond. Maybe not the best place for people who hate spice but they have plenty of choices for vegetarians!

Great authentic Indian food. Great location. Great price. Clean. Great lunch buffet. I love that they opened a branch at Southwest because its close to home. Not a lot of good Indian resto options in this side of town before.

I haven't had Indian food in years. Although I've never been to the other location, I can say this location is pretty new and cozy. We got seated pretty quickly on a Sunday evening and server was very attentive. 

Since I haven't had Indian food in such a long time, I had my friend recommend me some dishes. I ordered the buttered chicken masala and garlic naan bread, which was very delicious! Especially dipping that naan bread in the masala! I ordered a spice level of 6 but it wasn't too spicy, so maybe next time I'll keep that in mind and go up to a 7 or 8 spice. The wrong order came out for mine an the server took care of it quickly and gave me the correct order which I really appreciated. At the end of our meal, we all ordered lassi togo! All my friends ordered the mango lassi and I decided to try to rose lassi. The rose flavor wasn't too strong, it almost just tasted like plain yogurt, but I didn't mind! I tried the mango which is what I'll probably be ordering next time. But be aware, the lassi is extremely filling! That's why my friend recommended to order it last and take it togo so that we didn't get full in the middle of our meal.

I can't wait to come back and try their lunch buffet as I've heard many good things about it!
The best Indian food restaurant in Vegas! Love this place... Try the Doza! Amazing... Your stomach will thank you! Hahaha

I really like the atmosphere and cleanliness of the place. I also really appreciate how for every dish it indicates whether or not is is vegan, vegetarian or gluten free. However, after seeing all the great reviews I expected the food to be better. My SO and I agreed that it was lacking flavor/spices which is odd because Indian food is usually is loaded with flavor. The curries seemed as if they were very watered down. Even the sight and texture of the curries were very watery. Too bad because I really wanted to love this place.

Amazing food, so good that we went here two days in a row, authentic Indian flavors, be sure to check out the Inferno menu, and order with caution, I eat really spicy food but I couldn't even eat more than two bites, so go with the really spicy option but not the Inferno if you cannot handle serious heat. There are two locations, near the strip and another one further in town, we ate at both but liked the one near the strip better. Well go again every time we are in town.
My friend and I had girls night here. The service was awesome! Loved our waitress. The food was perfect. They have lots of Vegan options too. Definitely will be back.

Came in a few days ago for their buffet....did NOT disappoint!! The food was delicious. Tried a little bit of everything and 3 plates and 2 orders of garlic naan later, we were satisfied customers. 
Even my 2 year old was enjoying the mild spicy entrees. 
Definitely will be going back. 
For 2 people with 2 regular soft drinks total was reasonable at $30.

I've been a fan of Mint for a long time, and I'm thrilled that they opened a new location closer to where I live. The food at the Durango Mint location is just as delicious as ever. Tonight I tried the rose lassi for the first time, and it was delightful! My vegan friends also love the options here.

My favorite restaurant of all times. I love that this place is consistent. They are so clean and the food is always fresh. My family and I come here every Sunday. My grand kids are very picky eaters and they eat majority of the foods at Mint. The spices are spectacular and the owner is very humble and down to earth!!

My favorite place for Indian food in Las Vegas and has been since it first opened. I was overjoyed when I saw the new one going up on Durango and have been there at least five times already. The most recent visit was Saturday for the buffet. Pakora. Chicken korma. Chicken Tikka masala. Mutter paneer. Saag with mushrooms. It was delicious from start to finish. I don't eat naan - not gluten free - but even that smelled fantastic. My partner says it's the best naan he's ever had. I'll have to just take his word on that.

Great food, couple of times little inconsistent, but I guess it happens everywhere. I think the other location is little better and cozier. The newer location decor is not inviting for me, so I usually order to go. But definitely worth it to sit there and eat delicious paper dosa. Never tried the lunch buffet, but I heard it's very good and fresh.

This is one of the better Indian food places in town. I gave it a 4 instead of 5 due to their gimmicky fire hot food menu which I made the mistake of ordering one item and it was unedible. Pretty good authentic Indian food though I would go back

The ambiance was very good but it took too long for the food to come. The food was very good in its self. I would recommend the Malai kofta. It was a little expensive though. 
Overall I think it was nice

I have been looking for great Indian food in Vegas for a long time now and I finally found it. If anyone is addicted to Chicken Tikka Masala like I am then you will love this place. 

We ordered:

Garlic Naan
Cheese Naan
Chicken Tikka Masala - level 6
Rebel Curry - level 10
Saag Paneer - level 5


Honestly, everything was delicious. You will not be disappointed. Will definitely be back!

I'd love to say I tried Mint, but I didn't due to their incompetent "manager". I called to place an order of Korma with paneer. Before I could speak a word, the person rudely said "hold" and clicked off. I held...for almost 5 minutes. I proceeded to place my order or Korma with NO MEAT. I told him I would like Korma with no meat, add paneer. "We can't do that. We can do chicken.", he replied. I proceeded to repeat myself and stated again that I don't eat meat and asked why they can't add paneer. "We don't do that sir. The chicken korma is good though". Again, I repeated myself "I DO NOT EAT MEAT. Are you not listening to me"? He proceeded to raise his voice and tell me how they cannot add some cubes of paneer to some curry. I asked why not, he gave no valid reason reason outside of "we cannot do that". I asked for the manager so I could get this worked out, because I've never been to any Indian place that couldn't do that, in fact most places have the option right on the menu. "I am the manager", he said....right...they always are. Nevertheless, I hung up right there and deleted the idea of ever coming here from my head.

We can build a 30 mile long particle accelerator under ground. We can build a plane to fly 2,200 mph. We can reach space and make plans to colonize Mars. But putting cheese cubes into curry? That's just preposterous!

We normally go to the Mint location on the east side. Well since we live here we decided to check the place out. It's in a shopping complex, occupies a large corner section. On entry the restaurant is impressive as it's massive( talk about thinking big ) very big buffet station( but we were not there for lunch buffet) 
It's a Tuesday night so not as busy and we got seated right away. Seems like there were two servers and two bus boys. Our orders were taken and we ordered out food. Seems like people were waiting a long time for their food. 
Tried the regular samosa chaat( good) and stir fried lamb( asked for 10, the spiciest but when it came it it was rather a 3 at max) waiter said since its appetizer the sauce will not be too hot; I've had it much spicier at the East location. Oh well who cares it was still good. 
I ordered the Masala paper dosa and it came out first before our other food so I had to wait and not be rude and eat. Well when the dosa came out, it was not crispy around the corners and was rather soggy. Didn't enjoy it at all. 
Naan was good/ so was butter chicken. 
Overall being that it's new, I wasn't disappointed but not impressed either. I could have driven a few more mins and had what I always had at the east location. Oh well. Hope with time, the chef gets the food right so we can come back again.
Wow. This place is incredible. The curry is amazing. Im convinced they can make anything taste great. Our server was incredible.

I've been a few times. Once for dinner and the other times for the lunch buffet. The food is really good. I like the more mild side of Indian food, and they have a dish or two to satisfy that! 
The main server lady who always seems to be in charge is really nice and on top of things. For the lunch buffet, I wish the staff was a bit more on top of things. Naan must be delivered to your table and cannot be self served and HELLO naan bread needs to be aplenty for a buffet! The garlic one is delicious.

It was their 9th week opening at the new location. I like the open floor plan and modern decor. My husband and I were craving Indian so we came to try this place out. The manager who took our order was great and recommended some great dishes! My only complaint is it took about 20 minutes for our appetizer and additional 30 minutes for our dinner to come out. The owner came over and apologized and said they are still working on a lot of things. Apology accepted the food tasted great! But please dont make me HANGRY again.  
The lunch buffet set up looked pretty enticing I will definitely come in to check that out soon

Found this place on yelp. Nice surprise. Very upbeat, very friendly staff, and the food was great  menu is huge so we picked the combos off the last page. Lots of choices so it would take a while to try it all.
Came for the buffet wide selection everything was very tasty with good spice.  Chicken Tikka and rice was the highlight. Place was very clean as well a high recommend.

My family and I stopped in at Mint for their lunch buffet. There was no wait for a table for 5 on a Saturday. The buffet (around $15) had many veg and non-veg options. One of the added bonuses of this buffet, which sets them apart from other Indian buffets, is that they have dosas included on their buffet. It is made fresh to order along with plain or garlic naan. They also have a self serve beer tap with decent selections however this is obviously not part of the buffet. Service was standard and consistent with buffet service. Our naan orders were slow to arrive throughout but the overall taste and quality was good. I will definitely be back for another visit.

Overpriced food and drinks, third class service!
Waited 20 minutes for simple drink, 1 hour for a simple order
Never coming back again!
This is a jewel in the rough. Once you open the door you are magically transported to an Indian paradise, one with lovely decor, amazing food and great service.

ANDHRA CURRY with goat
Naan
CURRY PINEAPPLE FRIED RICE
MAHARAJA TIKKA MASALA with boneless lamb
Biryani with bone in goat
Tandori chicken

These are just a few of the amazing items on Mint's menu. It's a little pricy, but you get what you pay for here. Their naan is great; however; the employees always get a kick out of the fact that we order it uncooked so we can make it at home.

The food is great, nice selection and the food is kept in good containers to hold the heat at a healthy level, but the service is bad, we had to ask twice for a second round of naan that came after we asked for the bill, they have to step up their game on the service. The price for the buffet is about $15 so its a little steep in my opinion.

I love this Indian food buffet! The price is great at around $15 per person. The space is huge, very clean, and has polite staff. The food variety is ample with lots of vegetarian and non veggie dishes. If you come for dinner, try the prix fixe for two. I keep wanting to come back to it must really be that good. Tip: don't forget to try the Gulab Jum for dessert.

Okay, so here's the deal... This location is just as good as the other location but so much more space and a very relaxed environment. 

I've always said the food here was GREAT and I'm not going to say anything contrary of this new second location. We've only tried the lunch buffet thus far but the flavors are consistent with their original location. 

The way things are set up here are different as there is much more space (able to accommodate larger parties and functions perhaps?) and there is a self serve beer and wine bar where you can try the 2 wines and 6 beers they have on tap using a card to pay for 2 oz servings.

There is nothing like their chili chicken and their paneer korma and tikka masala! They actually even make fresh naan right in front of you in the buffet area!  I'm also a fan of their goat curry and I'm so happy to have a location closer to my house, not to mention, closer to my office!

You have to come here and give it a try! I'm sure you'll be back again and again!

Came here for the first time last night and had already decided this was my new favorite Indian spot after the samosas. I kid you not, these samosas are some of the best I've ever had. 

We decided to do the prix fixe/sampling menu. Definitely the way to go if you can't make up your mind. It consists of mainly the most popular dishes, and it is so damn good. It also includes appetizers and dessert, so you'll be stuffed by the time you leave. Not to mention that the food is AMAZING!!

The location has a fun, somewhat modern feel to it. Really enjoyable to look at and catches your eye. They also have a by-the-ounce self-serve beer and wine tap. We didn't try it out, but it looks like a cool concept. Mint seems to get busier around 8, so you may want a reservation if you have a bigger party. 

And I would be remiss if I didn't mention the incredible service. All of our questions were answered knowledgeably. We constantly received more water and everything was prompt. 

Great Indian place for a date night, group or just to satisfy that craving.

Tonight's dining experience was a bit disorganized. You could hear servers correcting each other aloud right next to tables, "They're ready for their dessert, not to go boxes." We were sent soup that wasn't ours and there seemed to be miscommunication among servers and food runners.

The worst part for me and my family was 4 staff members rearranging the whole seating area to prepare for lunch the next day, they carelessly drag chairs and made it so difficult to enjoy dinner. At this time it was still an hour before their closing. 

Besides that, I enjoy the food here a lot. I tried the Andhra curry tonight and loved it.

This is my go-to Indian restaurant. Delicious food that's always freshly cooked. High-end set-up of the buffet in-the-round. Service is fast & friendly. You can't beat the $14.99 Lunch Buffet from 11am to 3pm.

Had lunch with such wonderful family from Cali today and ended here ... food was delicious and place was spacious and relaxing ! Service was good too ! Live nearby and always wondered about this place ... was such a treat bec now we will just keep coming back -
Great experience . Clean, waitress was amazing and food delicious. Look forward to my next visit
Amazing buffet offer.  People keep coming in.   Whoever likes Indian food or wants to give it a try should come here.  My husband and I LOVE it here.

First off I will say I am so glad I tried Indian food.  However it was definitely not my favorite.  I came here for lunch with my husband and friends on a Saturday.  This place is perfect for this white girl.  Their lunch buffet allowed me to try a variety of items.  Lots of variety and flavorful dishes.  Great value for the selection. Fresh garlic naan was delicious.  Side sauces were a great addition for some of the dishes.  The place was clean and customer service was great.  I would definitely recommend this place if you are in search of trying Indian food but I'll probably stick to meatballs for myself.
Good food and friendly staff. We ordered dosa, paneer tikka masala and kofta curry. It was good but little pricey.Naan bread was fresh and good.

My husband and I have been patrons of Mint for years. I regularly order a dosa while my husband loves the chicken tiki masala. However the menu is full of delectable options from kabobs to curries to biriyanis. We have tried some of the other Indian restaurants in town but find they simply don't offer the range of both Northern and Southern Indian specialties that Mint does. The owner, Chris, and his staff never fail to disappoint with on spot service either. Mint is always our go to when we are craving Indian food.  We were super excited when they opened the new Durango location which is much closer to our home. Highly recommend!

Had a great dinner there, which was highlighted by the excellent service and recommendations of Julie, who really made it a wonderful evening. If it were not for her we would have been challenged to order due to the menu being huge. We highly recommend this place, reasonable prices, quality food, and watch the heat....it can get you. We can't wait to go back. Clearly the best Indian food convenient to Summerlin.

This is the 2nd time eating here and it gets better each time! The food is fresh, flavorful and perfectly portioned, but the service is what sets this place apart. Julie is so knowledgeable about the menu and she is great at guiding you into fun and new things that you may not normally try. We love that this place is near us and can't wait to come try the lunch buffet.

While pulling into the open parking lot, the area around Mint Indian Bistro was clean, spacious, and well maintained. The restaurant was lit up and easy to see from multiple angles of the streets. The parking lot was quiet, and other businesses around were winding down for the day while the restaurants nearby were opening back up for dinner. I found shaded parking in front of the building, and walked into the restaurant at around 5:30 pm on a Friday night. 

Upon entering Mint Indian Bistro, I was greeted in a timely manor by an employee of how many people were in my party. I was dining alone, and they offered me a comfortable booth in the corner of the restaurant. The atmosphere was open spaced, modern décor, and had a Buddha theme with black and silver colors complimenting the cultural murals on the wall. The establishment had a lounge area, buffet area, bar top, and a private dining area. Only one other table had been present since the restaurant opened at 5:00 pm for dinner. 

The music playing was upbeat, easygoing, and had an ethnic techno genre. Very fitting for the restaurant, and set the mood for the Indian inspired atmosphere. The aroma of the ingredients in curry, coconut, exotic spices, and chili pepper flowed through the restaurant. The overall atmosphere was very welcoming, enticing, friendly, and gave you a sense that you were in a fine Indian cuisine establishment. The server was very tentative, and helped assist in the perfect dishes to explore. The server suggested the popular pakoda with fresh vegetables as an appetizer, and chicken tikka masala as an entrée.

Starting with the popular pakoda appetizer, the sight was alluring with the colors on the plate. The appetizer was a fried dish, with two different sauces on the side. The pakoda was light brown colored, grainy, curdled, and asymmetrical. One of the sauces was a mint, deep green, and the other was honey colored brown sauce. The mint green sauce was creamy, pureed, and brightly colored. The brown sauce was translucent, dull, and had a glossy appearance. The aroma of the pakoda was mild, and the sauces had a sweet and sour contrast to them. The aroma of green sauce was minty, with hints of cilantro. The other brown sauce had aromas of tamarind and honey. 

Biting into the pakoda was mild, nutty, and slightly sweet. The flavor was mild until dipping into the sauces, which enhanced the experience. The sauces made the dish memorable, and paired well with the fried vegetable appetizer. The texture of the pakoda was semi solid, crumbly, moist, and smooth. The dish was served warm, slightly oily, and was fibrous. The balance was soft when chewing, and very savory with the paired sauces. Highly recommended. 

The chicken tikka masala came in a silver bowl with a side of white rice. The tikka masala was brightly colored red/orange, and had a creamy curry like appearance. The aroma was a combination of coconut, onion, garlic, and hints of chili and ginger. The dish was strong tasting with the exotic ingredients, and very flavorful over the white rice. The chicken tikka masala was slightly salty, sharp, and very savory. The texture was semi solid, lumpy, moist, mushy and very creamy. The dish was served hot, smooth texture, liquid like, and was had a melting sensation once it hit your tongue. Very complimenting balance of ingredients, flavors, textures, and overall experience. The combination of the two dishes truly gave the essence of Indian culture and cuisine with fresh ingredients, prompt service, and expert knowledge on the dishes.

I wish I could give half a star for this review. We ordered chilly chicken - that seemed like left over chicken from the linch buffet, Lamb kebab - not worth the price and in vegetarian - makai kofta and kadai paneer. They were small portions not even enough for one person. The taste was very average. Never going back there again. Really disappointed!

I finally decided to try this place right down the street from me...so glad I did.  The staff was helpful in helping this newbie to the cuisine order some great items.  My favorite was the chicken tikka masala...OMG...the rich and creamy sauce was heaven! I am definitely going to have to try some more items.  Beautiful interior and friendly staff.  AAA+++

If there is one thing I never ate growing up, it was Indian food, but forward 20 years and suddenly it's one of my favorite things to eat in the world, and Mint has decent Indian cuisine for date night prices and ambiance.  I especially enjoy the goat dishes here, and their naan is tasty.

Loving their new spot! Buffet varieties! Very spacious! Pleasant customer service! Don't forget to try their Cranberry Rice n Chili Chicken. Amazing! Fresh Garlic Butter Naan! We are enjoying our buffet now. Yay!!

The best Indian food I've ever had. This place is brand new. Very spacious and I like how the bar and tv's are central and away from the dining tables. They have a self serve wine/beer machine which the owner or manager named Chris was kind enough to show us and let us test out. We ordered rebel curry with chicken and Rogan Josh with lamb. Both were so tasteful and very well made. Probably the best curry I've ever had. The organic samosa was a little burnt on the inside but still flavorful. For desert I recommend the Gulab jamun it reminded me eating pancakes with sweet syrup. I will definitely be back with my family and friends!

Excellent Indian food. I went with a group of 12 for dinner  and they were very accommodating. It is a nice large space, tastefully decorated, not kitschy in the least. The food was DELICIOUS. At our table were carnivores and vegans and all we very happy with or dishes. The spice level was dialed up or down as requesed. My only small quibble is that the portions are on the small side so if going super hungry definitely order an appetizer. They do have a lunch buffet. Wish they had one at dinner. We all said we would be very happy to eat at Mint Indian Bistro again. This group frequently dines together and this is the first time there was total agreement on liking the place.

I love Indian food so I was really excited to try a new place in Vegas. Mint Bistro popped up with really good reviews and almost 5 stars so figured it would be a great choice. I wanted to order food togo so we sat at the bar and had a few drinks while we waited. The place is severely understaffed with one manager who may also be the owner. We were told that it would be a wait because they did have a large party next door and we were understanding of that. 30 to 40 minutes were quoted to us and it has now been an hour to 1.25 hours of waiting. Looking around the room many tables seem impatient and are also looking around wondering where their good may be. We were served samosas accidentally while waiting and those were very good. We thought they were ours bc we had ordered some togo but then were apologized to as if it was our fault for eating the persons order next door. The female managing was also unprofessional when she yelled out "shit!" when she entered the wrong side of the kitchen door as the employee was leaving the right side of the door with a tray of food. The table of eight behind us with children looked as this transpired. Unfortunately I won't be coming back.

If you love Indian food this new Mint location will not disappoint. The atmosphere is good, the staff is attentive and the food is delicious. They are still doing dinner buffet, and not a full dinner menu, but we didn't mind. The selection was excellent. I personally loved the chili chicken and curry chicken. We will definitely be back.

Sister place to the one on East Flamingo, this place is ginormous, With a walk up wine bar where you serve yourself. Food is absolutely top notch. you MUST try their pistachio dessert (well you must eat all of their food, but leave room for dessert) 

Service is a bit on the slow side, but I think that is just growing pains.
I would add 10 more stars to the 5 I posted!

YUM

Have heard good things about mint so decided to check it out.  I love Indian food and know what good food is.
Right in the middle of the lunch rush we arrive, place is empty, we are sat right away and given water and ordered garlic naan.
Place is impressive, nice decor and friendly service.  Food however was on a spice scale of 1, more like an introduction to Indian foods and flavors.  I like a 5 or 6 on the heat level and nothing on offer was even close.  Some dishes with chicken were only lukewarm so I skipped them.
They had yummy frozen pineapple dessert.
Amazing food!!!!! Good service and atmosphere. The lunch buffet is the best! Very authentic Indian cuisine.

We already had experienced Mint on the East side, and our young, hungry sailor was in town for the weekend so we opted for the new Spring Valley location on Durango near Flamingo.
I especially love my Indian food, after having lived in New Delhi for three years. 
I love lassi drinks, and tonight I was happy to have such choices: virgin lassi and lassi with either vodka or rum.
The black currant lassi was fantastic!
We started with some of the most wonderful samosas, with two sauces which were delightful.
We enjoyed saag palak with lamb, Thukta noodle soup with lamb, naan makhani, rogan josh, chicken masala, garlic naan, gulab jamun and rasmali for dessert.
we were greeted by Julie who was very helpful with our questions about the dishes. She was superb and made our evening delightful. All the service, decor, easy parking and food quality are extremely impressive, and we look forward to returning very soon!
Clean, spacious and great variety for Lunch buffet. Friendly and courteous staff. My new favorite Indian lunch buffet.
Amazing buffet! Peas pulao is soooo good. Great neighborhood location large and modern dining room. Super friendly staff.

My sister in law stopped eating meat during her pregnancy. So I thought what the hell? Indian food is the only option for me to have a decent meal without meat. The vegetarian combo they serve is very authentic and service was great . Just wish the place was a bit cheaper. But over all I keep coming back every now and then. Never tried the lunch buffet. Worth a visit

This place has a great buffet. Food was hot, they had a lot of variety, buffet and restaurant was clean, and labeled items. Mango Lassi was delicious. Their self serve beer and wine bar was a nice touch. Very spacious for private parties. I can't wait to go back!

The service was amazing. Jay was our server & he really took the time to explain the menu to us & give us some history on the food. I had the mango massala & it was excellent. I highly recommend this restaurant, so happy that Vegas finally has a good Indian restaurant.

BEST.INDIAN.BUFFET. I HAVE EVER TRIED YET! And, I dont say that in vain, I have tried numerous around the country. And, this is great with its price, ambiance, style, food-taste and presentation, and quality. Service is amazing too, not to mention they make the naan fresh!! in front of you!
Awesome. Lunch buffet is great! Lots of good stuff! Their mango pudding is awesome too

I was a fan of their flamingo location, so I was excited to have one on the westside of Vegas. First time we went they had recently opened and service was subpar. I figured it was due to working out the kinks and didn't think too much of it. The gluten free prix fixe dinner selection and gluten free blonde ale beer I can't seem to find in the stores in Vegas definitely made up for the lack of service. Went again two more times and service did not improve. The last visit after we had already ordered and waited 20 minutes, we were brought plates for our dinner and proceeded to sit there waiting for our food for an additional 10 minutes. I had to flag down the waitress to ask how much longer it would be, no apology or urgency to find out what was taking so long just told us it was coming. The decor is really nice inside and food has never been disappointing, but I won't go back due to lack of service.

I went to a business event here recently, that was held in their lounge. The interior is very classy, well decorated and kind of cool. The service was great and they even have a great quality german non alcoholic beer  which is very hard to find.  

I was thinking, "where I am going to afterwards" because I am just not a fan of this cuisine.
I was wrong, we were served several lamb and chicken dishes with curry''s and it was spicy but really very good.

I think I will try it at lunch for the buffet as other reviews have said

How did I miss this place. Literally across the street from where I live. Went in the afternoon for the buffet. Everything was amazing. Really nice individual buffet hot plates that are covered. Everything was labeled from what region of India came from. They also have some Asian influenced food also. Very happy with this place. The mango lassi was also delicious. They even asked me what type of Roti I would like plain butter or garlic. Great place.

The food was terrific. We had the lunch buffet and it had plenty of variety for both the vegetarians and non-vegetarians in our group. The restaurant organization was the downside of this place. They've only been open 6 weeks and they still have a lot to work on. They are definitely understaffed and the staff are still in training. 
They beer and wine wall was half operational and the price of the alcohol on the menu was better anyway. 
It's not fair to compare it yet to the original Mint of East Flamingo. With a few easy peasy changes, this place could be even better.

I had a cheat day and meet some friends here for lunch. It has been way too long since I have had Indian food! They have delicious naan, of course, as well as chicken tikka masala and saag paneer. I also had some garbanzo beans but I don't recall the sauce. It was all very good. Service was great and this is a clean,  stylish place. We paid $15 each for the lunch buffet. At the time, the I've cream machine was out of service. 

They had lots more options that I didn't try but next time I will go for them. I would definitely go back more than once.
Very enjoyable experience at this location of Mint. Food is simply perfect and the service very friendly. A fun place for a great Indian food experience.

We got a take out order, the boy in the front desk was extremely rude Indian boy; ordering us to sit down instead of waiting outside, more than once he commanded with a extremely disrespectful and loud tone to "sit down". We will not return due to the rudeness of the staff. P.s we feel he spit in the food, it came out very messy and seemed like strange bubbles in the food when we got home once we saw this we threw it all out. This did not happen today; but, some time ago we just did not have the time to leave a review. Regardless, will not return; nor will we recommend mint to any of our friends.

Mint is a very cool place. For lunch they offer a buffet with lots of delicious food. They clearly label which items are vegan and vegetarian which I really appreciate. The food is really good and the prices are great as well.

I balked a bit on the $18 buffet, but after tasting it I knew it was well worth the price. The selection was abundant work a wide selection of vegan and meat dishes. The service was great and the curried goat was excellent. Lunch buffet from 11 to 3
Great portions, great flavors, excellent customer service (Durango location)... But the bill can add up quick  I love their vegan Bhindi Okra Masala and their vegan Bombay Aloo Curry...

One of the best places I have ever been 
Grate customer service!!!!
Grate food will come back again...................................

The lunch buffet was outstanding! The food was hot,  delicious,  and appealing to the eye.  I will be going back as much as possible! It is by far the best Indian food in town. Fresh naan bread made in the buffet area.

This is definitely a wonderful discovery ! One of the best Indian restaurant I have every been to. The choices, the flavors, the ambience ! I just wish they open one in Cincinnati!!! I wish I can try everything on the menu! I highly recommend South Indian dishes !! Be brave and ask for recommendations!

I've been looking for a good Indian restaurant in Las Vegas and found it here. The naan was really fresh. Had it with butter and roasted garlic. For my main I got the lamb vindaloo. I asked for the heat to be 8 (out of 10). I did anticipate it being hotter as I really love the heat. Next time i'll get a 10. The dish was very good. Service nice and knew we were newbies and offered a lot of info. I'll be back.

I was here during their soft opening for the lunch buffet about a month ago.  I came back tonight for dinner.  The food was very pleasing.  The service was off which resulted in me removing a star from my earlier review.

The food was excellent!  The Andhra curry with chicken was beautifully spiced.  I got it at a spice level of 7 on a 1-10 scale.  I could have done eight or nine.  There was some kick but I like it spicier, not inferno, but reasonably spicy for normal people.  The samosas were good with good ground lamb and the basmati rice was well prepared.  The garlic naan rounded out a nice meal along with the gulab jamun for dessert.

Now to the service.  When I arrived, there were two tables besides me occupied.  There were perhaps four people covering the floor.  One man took by order for the samosas while I looked at the menu trying to decide on the main course.  He also asked for my drink order.  I asked for iced tea and he responded with sweet or unsweetened.  Unsweetened it was and he brought me a small dish with some regular sugar and several artificial sweetener packs.  Shortly into eating the samosas, when my tea wasn't even down a third, a server asked if I wanted a tea refill.  I responded with a not right now.

I finished the samosas, the curry, and my gulab jamun before someone picked up the empty glass--it had been for much of my meal by then--and brought it back full.  I added a packet of sweetener and then tasted this awful flavor because they had brought the sweetened tea which now had artificial sweetener also in it.  It tasted like raspberry tea but I only took a swallow or two and then left the rest.

There was a woman going around with a tablet taking orders from tables which are then instantly sent to the kitchen.  She seemed to be the key employee tonight.  When I was brought my bill, I saw that there was a large error.  The gulab jamun was charged at $80.  (I did not post the photo of that bill but I have it).  The person who brought the check went after the tablet carrier who then was occupied with a party of 4 at the "self serve" by the ounce wine and beer area.  I can see why it can't be completely self serve.  I have friends who would drink them dry unless monitored.  This, however, held up the redoing of the bill.

The service seemed like there was no coordination nor clear cut responsibilities.  No dirty dishes were removed from the table except for the samosa one.  All my dishes from the main course were on the table when the gulab jamun was brought.  I lifted my dinner plate to make room and placed it to the left and away from the eating area.  The person who brought the gulab then picked up that plate and took it but nothing else was ever cleared from the table while I was there.   It's been a month so they have had time to train the staff and the staff has had time to do their jobs.  This won't keep me from coming back because the food is so good but service people, you need to get your acts together.

Westside location is great closer to home.  The restaurant is massive, the best part is I could watch some old cricket games out there. It was a real treat to see cricket. 
Visited  them for buffet lunch, the spread is big n the food quality is top notch. I really liked the naan bread also
making process is in the open
Good work 
Good restaurant 
Recommend

Found an Indian restaurant that is authentic and most of all delicious. The service here is great and the manager is always around helping. They take great pride in their restaurant. Great place for lunch! Nice and quiet.

Pros:
Ample seating.
Food was decent.

Cons:
AC was out on a hot Vegas day.
Service was slow. 
Not enough options on the $15 buffet.
Most of the items were empty. Refilling was very slow.

Love this place! Came here for lunch and everything I had was amazing. I am vegetarian so I didn't try any of the meat however they have a wide variety of vegetarian options so that was great for me. My only "complaint" is I got too full very fast but I also tend to eat smaller meals. For sure will come back. Maybe for dinner next time and I'll make sure I'm Super hungry ;)

Out party of 7 visited this restaurant about 5 months ago. We kept calling for reservations but they dont pick up their phones. 
We arrived at downtown location and there was 45 min wait, so we ended up at their Durango Dr location 25 mins away, we were seated promptly but after about 5 mins asked to move to a different table. 
Waitress took drinks order for half of our table but never came back to take rest of the order. 
A different waiter kept coming back wanting to take our menu books away from our table. I told him twice: "we haven't ordered yet" but he was bent upon taking the menus. 
They got our drink orders wrong. Brought out more lassis than we had ordered (and insisted that we had ordered that number) and didn't bring a beer one in our party had ordered. 
Not much choice when it comes to drinks and the ones they have in menu, apparently they don't stock for. 
I ordered the Thandai vodka lassi, they told me they ran out. 
I ordered the Piraat IPA. "Sorry, we don't have it either". I then ordered the Bornem double Abbey Ale, waiter laughs and has the nerve to say: "you keep ordering beers we don't have" 
Seriously? I'm sorry!! But all these drinks are right here on your menu.. 
Needless to say, he never came back to take my drink order again. A third waiter stooped by after a while to get the menus. I ordered the boulder beer mojo IPA: same story: don't have it. (Fourth time) 
I finally gave up and asked the waiter to get me an IPA they have. 
A very elaborate menu. Salty lassi contained at least twice the amount of salt it should. The first in my lifetime That I hated salty lassi. 
Lychee rum Lassi: was so sweet it tasted like cough syrup. 
Raw papadum: they serves us raw papadum, absolutely disgusting... chewy. 
72minutes after we were seated, our food finally arrived! 
Kids ordered idlis: were pretty decent. Dal Makhni was good, the methi malai chicken was very good, baingan bhartha was unremarkable and malai kofta was excessively sweet. 
Bottomline: don't waste your time and money in this restaurant. Horrible service, disgusting drinks. Entrees are decent, (hence 3 stars) but for the wait and the money, I'd pick a place that is actually nice..
We went there for the lunch Buffett.  The quality of the food was top notch.   Best Indian food I ever tasted.

Me and my wife live only couple minutes away and we found this new place on Yelp so we love Indian food. 
We came over before they closed the buffet but was still a lot of food, hot and fresh ! 
For me opinion this buffet is the best Indian buffet in town !!! Very clean and quiet. 
I love this place and for sure I'll come back again to eat. 
I recommend this restaurant to anyone that love Indian food.

Great service with great food. I have tired almost all the Veggietrain items on the menu and I must say all of them are amazing. The Dosas are one of kind at Mint. Also try the Veggietrain entries with parathas.
Alway really great food and service. We are regulars here and went to their Paradise location for years. Great vegan selection, easily my favorite restaurant for Indian cuisine xx

Most sequels disappoint. Mint Indian Bistro's newest, second location, however, does not!! 
Very impressive and spacious when you first walk in and nicely spaced out tables and booths. Accommodates couples to booths to large groups and even booth arena seating to catch the cricket game! Efficient service and an eye-catching location for their chef centrally located among the buffet area. You have an immediate choice of butter or garlic butter naan and a dosa made to order. Then open to walk around the two roundabout buffet areas and the yummy side dishes and condiments and most importantly the dessert options! A flavorful rice pudding with cardamon and a surprise option of vanilla soft serve with an optional pineapple topping to make your own "dole whip"! A new local fave for us! Highly recommend.

Decided to try this hot new place for Indian Food. Cuisine is authentic, restaurant is upscale, and the staff friendly and accommodating.
Had a hankering for Indian food and the food here was the perfect fit. 
Lamb Masala, Saag Paneer, and Papadum were all on point!
We'll definitely be back for more!
Same great mint.  Huge and very open and modern new location man.  Come down cuz the staff is always so very friendly and helpful.

New location on the west side. 
Compared to the cozy smaller location on the east side this location boasts size, flat screen tv's, automated pour alcohol machine/dispenser, and live naan station!

This location also features a lunch buffet. 
My favorite lunch special! 
The quality of the food at this location is on par with Mint standards and very tasty. 

I do feel the staff at this location is friendly and I have developed a better raport with the employees here than at the other location.

Best Indian restaurant we have been to here in Vegas!  Excellent service.  Beautiful, huge, and best tasting lunch buffet (around $15 per person) with a wonderful set up and the Chef right there -- plus an ice cream machine too!  You get a nice variety and everything tastes freshly cooked, clean and scrumptious.  Totally worth it!  Julie, the restaurant manager circulates, works hard, helps out with everything, is refreshingly passionate about Mint Indian Bistro, and is interested in the customers.  We will be regulars!
There is no amazing Indian food in Vegas unfortunately, but Mint might be the closest thing.

My one star is for the service. The food is always a 5 star. The service is getting worse at this location. They are fairly busy, but seems like they don't have enough help in the kitchen.  It's very frustrating. And they only have one person sitting people and that person is also taking orders and act as the cashier. Service during buffet hours are good. The service during dinner just sucks bug time.
This restaurant takes the cake for Indian food. It's very clean, large selection of dishes, very reasonably priced,  it's great for the veterans and carnivores. I would only recommend Mint!!!!

I'm a fan of Mint Indian Bistro so when I found out that they had a new location on the Westside I had to check out the lunch buffet.

The spacious layout with contemporary furniture, quality silverware and flavorful Indian dishes were excellent.

Despite the fact the restaurant was light on customers, I felt my Waiter was lacking attention to my table.  Also, it was 48 degrees outside and it felt like it was 40 degrees inside even after I asked to be relocated to a table away from the window.

Whilst I remain a fan of this restaurant, I cannot justify spending $14.99 for a lunch buffet when so many Casinos offer quality lunch buffets for under $10.00.  Therefore, I will only visit this place occasionally instead of every week.

After returning from London, I have been trying to find a good Indian resto around my area. Our friends from UK got as hooked. My colleague have recommended Mint but it was the Paradise central to Las Vegas Strip is a bit annoying to get to. I was so glad that they actually have a new location convenient to where I live. I was advised to try their buffet lunch because I was not very familiar with a lot of Indian Dishes. This way, I get to try all of it and maybe order it at a later time if I decide to visit them during dinner hours (not buffet). Ok, onto review,

Ambiance: pretty interior, clean, impressive buffet station. Didn't get to take pics because I was really focusing on what dish is good. Haha. 

Food: Good Selection for the price. Nan is freshly baked and delivered to your table at your flavor of liking. Dosa is also freshly made all part of the buffet. I tried almost every single dish, amongst my favorite is goat curry, chicken tikka masala and tandoori. Everything is pretty good but mostly vegetable based with delish Indian spices. I guess that's why their price is $15. Children are half price. Everything in their end is pretty spicy to me and they offered to make, chicken breast kabob with cashew nuts and cream in a sizzling plate for my dd. She loves that with mango chutney on the side.

Staff: is pretty attentive for refills and delivery of nan bread. Someone comes to our table frequently to change plates and ask us if we need anything. I think the owner or the manager is he one who offered the dish for my daughter. 

Price for buffet lunch is reasonable, a little pricey for ala carte menu. 

Will definitely return for a lunch date with my hubs when my daughter is in school. There's not much for kids to eat because dishes are mostly above medium spice unless you are willing to pay more for the ala carte menu.(cost is more than 1 lunch buffet)

I enjoyed this place today. I'm glad I chose it for Mother's day!

This is the best place to go for Indian food! There is  no need to look further! The food is delicious, the service is excellent, and the restaurant itself is very clean.

I ordered the chana masala and the chicken vindaloo with, of course, garlic naan! The chana masala is a great vegan/vegetarian option. Even if you are not vegan/vegetarian, you will definitely enjoy it. It is full of flavor and has the right amount of kick to it (I ordered spicy level 4). The vindaloo was also very tasty. It has a slight vinegary flavor, in my opinion, but it is delicious nonetheless. 

Out of all the Indian restaurants in town, I would recommend Mint because their service was exceptional and the establishment is very clean. Other places might have decent food, but their restaurant is not always in tip top condition, which can kind of bring your appetite down. Overall, Mint has all of the aspects I look for in a great restaurant. Must try!

Have I ever told you that Indian food is my absolute favorite?  Okay, so I'll tell you again.  I've been eating Indian food since before many of you Yelpersnappers were ever born.  When I moved from Brooklyn to Queens, I was fortunate to be living a stone's throw from Jackson Heights, which was then cradle of Indian restaurants on the East Coast. It still may be.

But I moved from there to Central NJ, and all those restaurants must have heeded me and Horace Greeley, and moved west.  They all went to Edison, which became known as Little Bombay (or Mumbai, if you're a purist).  But there were - and are - also a plethora of Gujurati vegetarian joints, as well as tons of places from almost every Indian state. They've been moving west again, and now we have a growing Indian food scene here in Vegas.

Mint Indian Bistro on Durango is one of the newest, and it's a cavernous room, half of which is filled with tables and booths, the other dedicated to a bar and lounge, with a unique Lassi Self-Serve wine and beer station in the center.

We chose a table far from the door, but we were freezing.  Our obliging waiter, Jay, raised the thermostat, but that only seemed to be blowing cold air.  Turns out that our table was next to the somewhat separated buffet station area, and that must have had its own thermostat turned way down, because we got even colder.  We moved to a raised booth, and I was finally able to settle in and take my jacket off.  Even better, the booth was the right height and very comfortable.  I usually can't sit in them, since I'm too short for most and would have to eat like a dog, straight outta the bowl, and the tables are most often too far away from the seat.  This one was perfect.

No other reviews seem to be complaining, but I found the wine and beer prices over the top.  I won't pay $10 for a glass of Riesling, even if it's from Germany, unless I'm on the Strip and dying of thirst.  I've had too many good German ones at other places for a lot less.  So I had a small bottle of bubbly, and I was happy.

We like it when there's a Thali, especially when it's a new restaurant for us, because we get to sample more than a few items.  Here it's called a Prix-Fixe menu (for two), under the heading of Chef's Tasting Menu which, I guess, gives license to let them charge more!  But it is definitely a Thali, and we chose the non-Vegetarian option.  To be fair, it was somewhat different from the usual, in that we were served individual bowls of soup and individual desserts.

We started with the tomato soup, very flavorful with lots of cumin seeds to crunch on.  It seemed insanely oversalted, but I'm hoping that instead of salt it was from lemon.  It's easy to confuse the two in certain dishes.  The soup was served along with the appetizer, which we were able to change from pakoda to samosa.  The potato and pea filling was delicious, but I found the outside to be not as crisp as at other places, with a kind of different, softer texture.

The main course was accompanied by a separate small bowl of rice.  Rice was also one of the bowls on the tray.  The individual dishes were very good (lamb, vegetable curry, dal,) to excellent - tandoori chicken that had an unusually great smoky taste, and chicken tikka masala.  We didn't like the mixed pickles, but that doesn't mean they weren't good, they're just not our thing.  Yogurt instead of raita was a disappointment, but not as disappointing as the garlic naan.  It wasn't piping hot, which it should be, didn't have enough garlic, and desperately need some butter - it had none.

Much as we like gulab jamun, we chose kheer for dessert, since it's not as cloyingly sweet.  It was terrific.

Service was generally good.  While Jay seemed to be the primary waiter, everyone else pitched in.  But the problem was that when we, or any other table, weren't being served, the staff seemed to hang out in the kitchen.  So when we needed, e.g., spoons for the dal or yogurt, since none were provided, we had to wait, and wait some more, until someone decided to come into the dining room.

This venue has been open a month.  They will have wi-fi, but don't yet.  The food is mostly very good, and I hope the owner will check out all the previous comments, as well as my own, and work out the kinks.  We liked it and will come back, but it's not my favorite.  That could easily change.
My favorite Indian restaurant in Vegas. Great atmosphere, beer sold by the ounce and the food never disappoints.

We went here for lunch and their buffet spread was delicious! They have a good selection of vegetarian dishes and a few meat dishes. I was hoping they would have some seafood, like fish stew or shrimp curry, but they did not. I tried almost all of the food they had at the buffet that day and they're very good. I've eaten authentic Indian food before from friends, and in restaurants when we travelled to other countries. I have certain expectations when eating Indian cuisine, but this place is really good, so I would come back. The restaurant is quite spacious and because it was lunch, not very crowded--which I prefer. The only thing I did not like was the iced tea that I ordered--it did not taste good at all. Otherwise, the buffet spread was really enjoyable.

Super cool place. Very chill. 

Self serve beer! Btw they have strawberry beer, just saying...
Went during the buffet hours, was skeptical since I saw a few reviews that stated it was expensive and I was taking my mom to lunch, but it was about 30 for the bill.

They make the naan fresh and right for everyone to see. The endless masala, and milk balls. My mouth is watering just writing the review. The curry goat is what my mom puts as "the best curry goat she's had since she live in D.C." idk what that means, but she sounded thoroughly pleased.

The E.Flamingo location was one of my favorite restaurants. Now that they are located on West side I don't have to go across the city for my Mint Bistro lunch or dinner.  Went for Lunch Buffet  during the Soft Opening, food was great. Loved it!
The chicken tikka masala was delicious, will definitely be coming back. The service was also unforgettable. JD was our server and gave us great service. Thank you.

I had heard many good things about Mint, so I was excited to give it a whirl with their new location being so close to home.

My BBF and I tried their lunch buffet ($14.99pp) and we both felt that it was just okay. A couple things that influenced our decision was the selection and the overall spiciness. I understand their spiciness is appropriate (according to a friend from India), however, it was a bit too spicy for us to enjoy. That was disappointing since it affected dishes that we are normally able to eat.

I was really sad they didn't have Chicken Makhani or Samosa. I don't always find Makhani, so that wouldn't have been a huge deal, but no Samosa?! Also, their Garlic Naan was not great. The fresh garlic butter concoction is applied prior to the Tandoor, so it's obviously burnt in the process (seriously, burnt garlic is gross). It's also sparse and sadly lacking that wonderful garlicky flavor. Things I did enjoy: Goat Curry, Vegetable Korma, and Vegetable Pakora.

I've been told their dinner is much stronger and the spicy level can be dialed down, so I may need to give them another chance!

The food here is amazing whether it is for dinner or for the lunch buffet. However, the service here is awful. My friend (who has eaten off the inferno menu before) wanted to order the inferno kabobs, but when she asked the server a question about the inferno kabob's he rudely said "no that's not for you, you cannot handle that." We then explained that she (my friend) eats spicy food regularly and he continued to reject her by telling her to order the regular kabobs. After we told the server that she ordered the inferno fried rice before, he didn't believe us. Overall, we were very upset and didn't even want to order anything anymore.

The food, atmosphere, and service were all great.
Huge menu selection. The seasonings were spot on. Everything from the different curries to the samosas and naan were all delicious. We had meat and vegan dishes. The selections were plentiful. The place has a great high end beer selection and the interior is very spacious and clean. Everyone was super nice. We finished our meal and stayed chatting with our friends. We never felt rushed to vacate the table even though the restaurant was pretty full. I would say that the ladies room could be a little cleaner, especially for a new place. They could also dress it up a bit to match the nice dining room.

I have not tried a lot of the Indian cuisine in Las Vegas but my Sikh friend recommended this place and he was correct. They offer spicing for all tastes on a 1-10 scale and seven brings significant heat. Try the lamb dishes and I think you will enjoy.
Fantastic food. Amazing flavors. Buffet was well set up and large range of meal options to try.
Went ro Durango Mint.. What a treat... Room, room room. Food good good good... Aways like the Mint food.. But  Flamingo location very crowded.. Best Indian cuisine in town.
Great variety of food for lunch buffet, the flavor are amazing, and the servers are friendly and courteous

When I heard a new Indian restaurant was opening up in the Southwest, I was over the moon! Alas, this place just isn't very good at all. 

We came here for the lunch buffet and were immediately greeted and seated. A bus boy (I guess) brought over a bottle of water and left it along with 2 glasses at the table. My boyfriend (starving) got up and already headed over to the buffet while i waited for the waiter. After about 5 minutes, the hostess who greeted us told me I should go up and grab some food, that they would bring naan to the table (I just wanted to tell our waitress we wanted a diet coke and iced tea... and we were both having the buffet... but OK).

So I head over to the buffet and there are no plates. No biggie... I'm sure it happens everywhere, so I just stand there awkwardly waiting for plates. I see the hostess again and ask her for plates and she told me I could have a seat and they would be out in about 5 minutes. 

Finally, the plates are out! Yey! I head over to the buffet and the floors are so dirty my shoes are literally sticking to the floor ~ like the floor had been coated with a thin layer of honey. I'm too hungry to care, so I dig in... After noticing that most of the dishes were almost gone (like just the swill at the bottom of the bin), I mixed and matched some white rice, masala rice, chicken tikka masala, paneer tikka masala, a mushroom vegan dish and a weird yellow pepper dish I'd never heard of or seen before (there were no spinach dishes, which was really disappointing-- love me some saag!)

*Also, some of the dishes had printed pieces of paper next to them that said whet they were... printed and just laid out on the table with no stand or anything, and others were written on torn scratch pieces of paper next to the food. They need to invest in some cheap acrylic display stands or something. A torn up piece of paper lying on the table next to a dish is kind of weird and lacks a professional touch imho.

Sadly, the rice was really hard and was either under-cooked, or old and dried out. The vegan dishes were inedible (just not good) the chicken tikka was A-OK and passable, but very much tomato based and not nearly creamy enough-- same as the paneer masala.

There were 2 gulab jamun left in the bin... which I helped myself to for dessert, and I put khir over top of them. The gulab were very dense and not light balls of sugary goodness-- again like they'd been sitting there for a really long time, and the khir was 90% sugary milk and 10% rice. Not the correct consistency at all.

All things considered, the hostess was nice. The waitstaff... non-existent, the food, mediocre at best. We won't be returning. 
(The waiter or waitress never did come to the table-- we went up and paid for our water and 2 buffets at the hostess counter-- $32 plus tip... for who knows).

I've been here several times and this is now my favorite indian buffet on the West side!  The service and food is excellent.  I like that the food are in dishes with built in lids to keep the food  covered and hot as compared to other buffets that has the food uncovered in warming trays.

Darn. I really wanted to like this place. There is a lot of potential here- the decor and atmosphere is great, tvs are nice, serve yourself beer and wine is kitchy but cool, and most of the food we had was good. 

Unfortunately the painfully slow service killed it for us. Took so long to get our drinks- tea and juice- that our apps came out first. We had eaten all our apps before we could flag down the server to take our entree order. Another 20+ minutes for our food- the tikka masala and saag were great. The lamb kebobs were extremely dry and overcooked- we didn't eat them. But we didn't send them back because the server never made it back over to check on us so by the time we were ready to get the check, it just wasn't worth it. The server was also answering phones, seating guests,  making drinks at the bar, taking to go orders and waiting on tables- yes just 1 person doing all of this. So of course there's no way one person could handle all this well, plus he had no sense of urgency. There were 2 busser/food runners who seemed to also have no sense of urgency. One of them was just standing around twice when we asked him if he could get our server. Our table remained cluttered with menus, plates and glasses that should have been removed the entire meal. Just too many strikes.

This place needs to staff better and train that staff on customer service, sense of urgency and basic steps of service like clearing tables during the meal, etc.

Where's the mint??? Seriously, though, Indian food is supposed to be flavorful and spicy (not necessarily hot). The lunch buffet at Mint seemed mild and dull (the chicken tikka masala was a little sharp and acidic). The pakodas were disappointing. You batter and deep fry things to make them crunchy. The pakodas are stored in a closed dish, and they get soggy very quickly. 

That aside, nothing is really bad at Mint. The naan was fresh and crispy. The plain rice was nice and flaky, no stick. You'll find staple items such chili pickles, tandoori chicken, and dal. 

The restaurant has trendy decor, music, a big screen TV, and a self serve bar. Mint would probably be a great place for dinner. For lunch, it's too dark and closed in. There are other Indian lunch buffets that are cheaper with better food.

There are many ways to be happy in this life, but all I really need is garlic naan!  I've never been to their original location, but it looks like they were successful enough to open a second location!  

Upon walking in I was amazing at the size of the place.  It's not small and cozy, it's big and inviting!  It looks like this place can be rented out for private parties and banquets.  They have air walls cutting off the other half of the restaurant.  The main room holds about 100 people which is a lot more than most Indian restaurants I've been to can hold.  I'm sure the other half of the room can hold a lot more people too!

The food was delicious.  Lots of options, both meat and vegetarian.  Everything you know and love about Indian buffets can be found here.  They even have an oven at the buffet so you can see them make naan in front of you!  Speaking of the naan, maybe I'll ask for it to be crispier next time.  It was delicious but flopped when I picked it up.  

My only gripe is that I came in an hour before dinner and the servers were busy setting up for dinner.  They actually never checked on us or offered us beverages.
