There is a fully loaded bar and they even have a self serve beverage area!  You can grab a glass from the cooler and serve yourself some beer or wine.  It's neat and something I've never seen before.  

The lunch buffet is about $14.99 and well worth it with all the options available.  I will definitely host a banquet here as well.  Check it out as it's less than 5 minutes from the 215/Flamingo freeway exit!

Mint Indian 

I don't usually leave reviews....

But when I do it's from the bottom of my heart. 

As I've stated, Mint is the Best of Las Vegas and its cuisine trumps all their competitors. 

My tongue appreciates the quality scrumptious goat, the juicy and never dried tandoori chicken and I can keep going on about the rice, naan or any dish I've encountered, but today something shocked my heart and filled it with love more than my tastebuds can ever describe. 

Honesty....

The food is honestly cooked with love just like mama's flavor but the owner Kris is more than just a perfectionist, he is also an honest man. 

I've lost $700 today, maybe $700 isn't much to you or to many but it's very important to me and it makes a difference in my life. 

As my heart beats on for 120 per minute, I relentlessly contact Mint and find the Manager's calming and caring voice "com'on in, we are waiting for you!"

....the rest is history and now my heart is filled with love by this HONEST man, Kris, the owner. I've tried to offer Kris money but he refused, he simply would like my guest and I to continue visit Mint. 

I will definitely visit Mint agin, but I'm also sincerely inviting you to visit Mint and share this lovely place with your friends and loved one.

To be honest I will go back and try it again.  I went the first few days they opened on the west side. 

I have also eaten at the east side location.  Very different vibe at each location.

Large selection of Indian menu items including South Indian specialties.  Lots of vegan & vegetarian options as well.

This is my absolute 1st and favorite choice for Indian food. Service is always perfect, and the food is absolutely amazing!!!! Tons of options to choose from and the rating of spice is exact! Lunch Buffet is awesome. (Mixture of their choices in my picture)  
I highly recommend if you want to try Indian food or just plain craving it!!

The only place in Vegas with a tandoori oven--it was interesting to see the cook making naan bread in front of you while you're getting food. Lots of different choices of appetizers, entrees and curries, it was also cool to see a pour it yourself beer service station with a full size bar. The food was all flavorful and delicious as well. This was my first experience trying an Indian buffet and its sufficed to say that I was more than impressed and happy with the food and the whole experience.

Excellent service, good food, very clean restaurant. The New Years Eve party was a blast. They had made good arrangements for Adults & also for people with with kids. The DJ from LA was excellent. At least now there is something for people to do in town. The food was exceptionally very good. They had chefs cooking live in front of u.  The turn out for the first time they did New Years Galla was sold out. I hope they do something next year to. My friends &  we had a great time. These people need a big .

I have been waiting for Mint Indian Bistro to open on the west side and when it finally happened, they hit it out of the park! As a Summerlin resident and regular of the east side location, I cannot be more delighted with what they have done. It's spacious, elegant, hip, and welcoming all rolled into one.  I had the buffet today, and the food is simply heavenly. The garlic naan which was made in front of me by the chef was the best I ever had. Everything was as delicious as I had hoped. I kept wondering if I was really there or I was dreaming, as I had so often wished they would open near me and now the dream has come true! Hands down, the best Indian restaurant in town! Thank you!!!

"Thank you for calling technical support, how may I help you".

I mean no disrespect but that is essentially 50 percent of my experience with India.  The other 50 percent comes from sampling the Sub Continent's spicy, bold, uber flavorful food at numerous places in Soho London.  Impressive huh.

Most Indian places in Vegas are known for their very inexpensive and decent lunch buffets.  Mint offers a respectable one at $14.95 but dinner and the plethora of dishes is where this place stands out.

Tip:  New to Indian cuisine, try the tasting menu (2 person).  Less adventurous dishes and a well rounded selection.

Begin with a few starters to sample the complex, spicy chutneys.  The bhel puri (rice crackers with a coconut, tomato, and mango chutneys) and padi chaat (pan fried potato cakes topped with garbanzo beans, mint and tamarind chutney) both very good.  Try them without the yogurt to really taste the flavors.

From here, interactive dining begins.  Order a bunch of mains and fresh cooked flat breads.  Dispense with the utensils and let the pinching and mopping begin.

The naan, puffy, soft and warm straight from the oven.  Plain is best (remember, this is a mop).  The puri (deep fried puffy bread) very neutral if adding richness is needed, the unbuttered piping hot roti (think of a whole wheat, unpuffed naan just chewier) makes a very good platform for heartier braises.  

Warm, spicy (both heat and ground spice blends), tender braised chunks of protein and a layer of fat eagerly await pinching and mopping.  The korma (ordered with lamb) very good.  Earthy, with very powerful turmeric flavor, good heat, fall apart tender lamb.  Cashew nuts add texture and its oil blends well.  The Baingan Bharta (pureed roasted eggplant simmered with tomato, onion, garlic and chilis) a great foil for any dish; neutral texture and not fatty.  the Chetinad Curry (spicy, earthy spice blend, coconut, and chicken) exemplifies what most of us consider Indian.   

Friendly and thankfully helpful off Strip service.  

Good selection of beer.  Think light and Asian to cut the spice.

A fun, interactive meal that, if you're like me with legume laden spicy foods, provides another weapon for the poker players arsenal.   Can we say mustard gas?  Oops, TMI.
Nice buffet. Way better Indian food than bay area. Went three times in our 5 day trip.

Delicious Food, Great Service, and a Beautiful Venue for Entertaining!

Absolutely love this place! The lunch buffet is always so flavorful. Not overly spicy for those who tend to stay on the mild side. They change a few menu items on the daily. The naan bread is absolutely delicious. Dinner menu provides soooo many choices. I always, always get the saffron organic cauliflower. The staff is always attentive, friendly and quick to take your order.
Amazing options for vegans and meat eater! Atmosphere was beautiful, service is not as attentive as we'd want. Definitely going to come back for the food!
The paneer is the best ! Lunch buffet $14.99 is unbeatable. Julie at the front is super. Love this place !

They have a great special for two people and you get to try a lot of different dishes, which is good.  We ordered at 2 in spice, but it came to us a 5 or so.  A little on the hot/spicy side.  The naan was really good and service was really good.  We didn't wait long, and they kept an eye on the table.  The downside?  They played football on the big screen in the main dining room.  I like football, but if I wanted to watch a game, I would have picked my dinner up or ordered pizza.  I asked them to turn it down, which they did not.  There were only a few people in the restaurant, none of which even glanced at the screen.  Basically, the guys that worked there were watching the game.  It was loud and ruined the whole Indian dining experience.  Even worse, they could have played it low in the bar section and it would have been just fine.  The restaurant itself was beautiful.  So....if you want to go to watch a game while you eat - this is the place for you!

With locations on East Flamingo and South Durango it is the belief of some that Mint Indian Bistro offers some of the most authentic Indian Cuisine in all of Las Vegas, and with a daily Buffet from 11:00am until four o'clock daily it was on Friday afternoon that schedules aligned for a visit.

In general a competitive market, the East Side admittedly far moreso while Mint's opening in Spring Valley actually filled an unlikely void in late 2016, guests entering the strip-mall location at 4246 South Durango Drive will find themselves immediately greeted at the door by one of two male servers behind the register of an elegantly designed space, "The Lassi Bar" proudly standing just ten feet away offering self-service Beer and Wine by the ounce.

Joining India Oven Masala as the only Restaurant in the Valley with a live Naan and Dosa station, the former made to order for each and every guest visiting the Buffet but Dosa only offered at Dinner, it was immediately after seating at a spacious booth that Water was poured with a full-bottle left for refills, a brief perusal of the individual warmers full of Food showing far fewer options than at many of Las Vegas' competing Buffets with more than half of the offerings either Vegetarian or Vegan.

Describing their menu as fresh, rich and complex, an "Inferno Menu" featuring Ghost Peppers offered to those crazy enough to sign a waiver in hopes of landing a picture on Mint's wall near the restrooms, it was by way of several trips and small portions that all but the Paneer Tikka Masala and White Rice were tasted over the course of sixty minutes, plate one showing Vegetable Pakora to be both oily and too thickly battered while the Bone-in Goat Curry was tender, lean and boldly spiced without being too "hot," a similar statement befitting Chicken and Potatoes in a deep red Sauce bold with Garlic, Cumin and Ginger that was so good it warranted seconds.

Enjoying two types of Naan with the meal, the quartered round painted in Ghee cooked a bit more crisp than one awash with Garlic, fans of Coconut Chutney will be happy to know that Mint is one of the few places in town that puts the lightly spiced condiment on its Buffet, the more typical Mint and Tamarind also present along with housemade plain Yogurt and spicy Pickles plus thick Mango Jam that goes great with fluffy Idli Rice Cakes or even the Tandoori Chicken.

Presenting just the Goat and four Chicken preparations as part of the Buffet, the Tikka Masala expectedly popular with a mostly Caucasian crowd, those looking for a bit more heat would do well to procure a scoop of the fusion-y Chicken Chili, the addition of Soy Sauce to cubes of Breast Meat and Peppers giving the dish an extra bit of intrigue that also pairs it well to thick Noodles and mixed Vegetables found near the Tandoori oven.

A bit disappointed by the lack of Samosas or Palak Paneer, both universal staples of other Indian Buffets in town, it was with another scoop of Chicken Vindaloo that a few spoonfuls of Dal Tadka confirmed no more was necessary, the Cauliflower and Potatoes faring far better as did the thick, earthy and never-before-seen Mushroom Mutter.

Reportedly using only "natural, antibiotic free meats," the cost of such perhaps part of the decision to limit Buffet options as they have, Desserts once again offered fewer choices than the likes of Delhi or Everest, the Kheer fairly low in sugar but nice and thick while the Gulab Jamun were piping hot, spongy and as sweet as expected.

***A bit more limited than other Las Vegas Indian Buffets, the website's suggested cost of $12.99 actually $14.99 + tax and tip as charged, Mint Indian Bistro is a fine choice for those in the area who do not wish to drive far, but for those looking for more variety or a lower price there are better places to be found. 

RECOMMENDED:  Chicken Vindaloo, Chicken Chili, Mushroom Mutter, Coconut Chutney, Mango Chutney.

Clean environment. Professional staff. Relatively fair pricing. Good tasting food. 

Lunch buffet is $15. Standard, but well presented, selection, plus some Chinese dishes. Freshly baked naan bread included. Enjoyed my meal, and will return again. 

Recommended to anyone who enjoys Indian food or is interested in trying for the first time. For first timers, lunch buffet is ideal.

The food was very good. There were many selections, including special dietary needs such as vegan and Jain! My only compliant is that I asked for spicy level 1(from scale of 10) for my organic aloo gobi masala, but it was still very spicy. The staff were very pleasant, but the service was a bit slow. I personally was not a fan of the carrot pudding... But they ran out of all the other vegan dessert options so that's why I got it. Wish I didn't get the dessert at all. I would come back again, and would recommend this place to others!

Indian food that impressed my palate, but did not destroy my intestines! 
It was my first time here, and I was brave to try something new. I have heard amazing things about this place, and I was not disappointed. We had the following:
Naan (description from the website)
Warm soft, puffy bread baked lovingly in a special clay oven, or topped off with fire roasted garlic or stuffed with your choice of chicken & chilli, ground lamb, onion/cilantro, or paneer.
Kadhai
Chunky quartered green bell peppers and onions pan-tossed with a barrage of homemade paneer cheese, tofu, chicken, lamb, goat, fish or shrimp and a flurry of green chillies, ginger, and coriander that drenches like an Indian monsoon.
Karma Korma (MY FAVORITE!)
A creamy sauce sprinkled with cashew nuts and assorted home grounded spices. Embrace your karma and try this dish fated to be your favorite. Vegans no longer need to skip this one.
They were all really tasty, and some amazing flavors that it kept my grub buddies (4 in total) busy. No talking for a good 20 minutes. Each dish came with a side of rice, but I gravitated to the naan bread. By the end of the dinner, there was not one piece of food left. Naturally, we skipped dessert because it was not humanly possible to squeeze anything else in. 
As for the 4 stars, the service was okay. It took a good amount of time for our food to come. I was surprised by the cost of the items, they were higher then I anticipated $12.99 to $15.99 for entree.
I look forward to trying more items during the lunch buffet.

This place was the place to be! The food was so delicious, the service was amazing, and the drinks were on point. Specifically the 5 spice passion fruit mojito was a spectacular drink!!
Definitely will come again!!
Best Indian in town hands down. Vegetable Korma, Paneer Tikka Masala. Amazing with buttered garlic naan.

My first time here. Really clean and nice. I went for dinner and the food was good. I wish I went for lunch because they have a buffet. They have big TV screens that had sports games going on and of course they had a nice bar section.  I definitely would come back again. It looks like a great place for big parties. Prices were reasonable.

Safe to say, if you don't like Mint's original east side location you:

1. Will not like this one
2. Should probably get the brain checked out

Their ambitious, new west side location is HUGE.  The open space is well designed and would make for a rockin party full of people and lassi showers.  But on a random Tuesday night with a total of 6 customers in the place, we looked like detainees in an empty nightclub being served delicious food to pass the time.

And delicious was definitely my key word for their dosa!  Hard to find for dinner around these parts, consider me all-in when this fantastic South Indian delicacy is available.  Their "Butter Masala Dosa" works great as either an entrée or an appetizer for 4.  Stuffed with spiced potatoes, cheese and onions, this 2.5 foot "prince of carbs" will undoubtedly get appetites revved up for what else is to come.  The paper thin crispiness and rich buttery flavor in every bite of this huge crepe is simply delightful.  The curries we sampled were all solid as well with the "Maharaja Tikka Masala" being my favorite on this most recent visit.  I also love their korma and vindaloo.

Even though I favor dinner over the lunch buffet at their original location, this new area looks absolutely stellar and offers a more expansive selection that I eagerly await digging into soon!
Great food and service!  So glad it's just down the street from my apartment definitely going to be back to try out their lunch buffet!
Honestly one of my favorite places to go! I love the customer service and of course the food!

I recently went to the westside Mint location with some coworkers for the lunch buffet. I'll admit: I'm always hesitant with buffets... I've had my fair share of bad experiences. But I have to give Mint's lunch buffet credit. It was delicious!! This location has a larger selection of food on their lunch buffet and they have someone making fresh made naan right there (note: don't try to pick that up on your own. they get a bit angry and tell you to sit down and they'll bring it to you...) 

Buffets are good for trying new things, but the food is often less spicy than my preferences. There was one noodle dish that was spicy and delicious and I'd never tried it before. Otherwise, the rice was rice, the tikka masala was good (but not spicy), the chili chicken was tasty, the fried cauliflower was super yummy. They did have a good mix of vegetarian vs non-vegetarian dishes. And you do get naan... but you have to wait for them to bring it to your table. 

The price is pretty decent. I think it was either $14 or $16 per person, which is a bit more than I'd want to pay to go there often, but once in a while isn't too bad.

I just had the vindaloo and Tikka masala and for 1. Thing why does a place with 4 stars in yelp serve over cooked shrimp and chicken. 

I mean my 14 year old says "This shrimp is rubbery they really over cooked this. Why m i 14 and know better than the cook?" ? 

She ain't wrong though. Look I don't like dropping $70 for mediocre Indian "cuisine" 

The flavors of the vindaloo and masala are mediocre at best.  And I can deal with that but the meats being so over cooked that I can't even eat it .... like are you serious. I'll be bringing this whole order back bundled up. 

Stop letting people who don't care about the quality shovel mediocre crap out when you're over charging for it. 

Shrimp takes only minutes to cook like holy crap I don't want a shrimp flavored vindaloo because you simmered the shrimp in it all day 

The chicken tika flavor is off to me however it was really the cubes dry as heck chunks of chicken. 

Even the Naan there is Mediocre.  It is thicker than most Naan I have eaten yet less flavorful. Definitely was not impressed for my first time eating this food. The staff is super nice that's not an issue it's just the cooks are mediocrely cooking their food. 


Hire someone who understands vegetables and flesh of animals and loves showing his understanding by what they cook. Whoever is cooking tonight is bitter and angry.

Was greeted and seated to our table, but no one came to the table for 5 min or so therefore we flagged the hostess down to ask about the buffett.  Then we had to flag the busboy down to ask about getting a beverage.  Mind you it was not busy at all and there were several employees around. We tried many of the buffett options.  The food was just okay.  Have had better Indian food.  My impression of the workers were that they did not want to be there.., maybe if someone smiled a little bit.  We also had to flag a waiter down to get our bill, and like I said it was not busy at all. Will not return.

Good to fill your tummy, and very few items to relish/ cherish. 

Had lunch buffet on weekend. Restaurant was semi full so there was no waiting time. 

- Not so tasty starters, no varieties

- Main course curries were good, waiting for bread was long, we had to remind twice by going to the counter. 

- Veg soft noodles: Noodles was over cooked, sticky/ soggy. Didn't taste good. 

- Idli Sambhar: Idli were hard and sambhar was too thick. Didn't taste good

- Gulab Jamun: was hot and tasty
- Mango Lassi not included in buffet, neither there was tea/ coffee

There are many good reviews. My expectations are more focused on quality and customer service, which I felt were mediocre.  Being vegetarian, I didn't try other non-veg curries.

One of the better Indian buffets that I've been to. I was a bit concerned, because the hostess/waitress was an American, but I enjoyed the quality of the food; they also were making their naan fresh in the center of the restaurant, a pretty nice trick and not one I've sen before. The menu is a bit odd because it has a few Chinese items on it, and the buffet had one or two Chinese dishes. But it's a place where you'll certainly get your money's worth for a lunch.

The first few times I went here when they opened up the Durango location the food was delicious and just as good as their other location. 

Unfortunately, the food during the buffet the last couple times i was here in March/April the taste and quality of the food has just gone downhill. Even one of the staff at the restaurant said the chef at the other location is much better when I mentioned the food isn't as good anymore. 

Hopefully they can improve the taste of the food of the Durango location to how it was when they opened, or just as good as their other location other side they'll be losing a lot of business. 

I probably won't be coming back, which sucks because this was an awesome place and convenient location for good indian food.

This was an absolutely brilliant restaurant. Taste was phenomenal and service was even better. I would definitely recommend this for everyone and I mean everyone. The owner understands the people and is always accommodating, takes care of you like one of his own. The beer/wine on tap as well as the lassi bar is something new, you should definitely check out both locations depending on what is easier for you.

BEST IN TOWN A MUST TRY!!!! This is hands down the absolute best Indian in Vegas. I'm so so happy to see them on the west side finally:) We always used to drive 30+ minutes to the east location. 

Everything on the menu is amazing . If you have never experienced Indian food I assure you that you will undoubtedly be coming back once you go here. I have listed my favorites below: 

Chicken Tika Masala 
Chicken or lamb Korma 
Any of the Naan breads (garlic is my fave)
Samosas -any 
Lamb paneer

Mint is probably my favorite Indian restaurant. The food is always fantastic. They have more than enough options on the buffet and on their menu. The menu is clear and easy to understand especially for people who are new to Indian food. Their service is great, employees are always welcoming and happy to see you. They will accommodate to almost anything you'd like, and try their best to make your dining experience a great one. My favorite thing to order is the classic garlic naan, chicken tikka masala, and rice. It always comes out warm and the spice level is perfect every time. The interior of the restaurant is very classy and modern, with plenty of space and a very unique self serve beer and wine area. I would highly recommend dining here!

The best Indian food in town, so happy they have another location at spring valley closer to my house , much bigger area and also the parking ....the service and the food are great ! Have to come back for lunch buffet for $14.99 SOON..... highly recommended if you love Indian food !

Best Indian food I have ever had!

I had the palak paneer and the spice content was perfect!

They have a great variety of vegetables and meats to include in your entree including goat!

People interested in a few beers will also like the microbrew located within the restaurant

What a beautiful place BUT.....  gorgeous mosaic, great big screen tvs, comfortable seating, are the positives . Appetizers were out before drinks, worst bus service and not enough waiters. I choose not to return after spending $87 for that.

If you're an Indian food newbie, the best time to go is during lunch time from 11am-3pm . They have buffet style set up and you get to try a little bit of everything. It might seem awkward if this is your first time going there as the place is huge and sometimes you don't know if you should start serving yourself, but the plates and everything are at the back left. Just start as soon as the waiter gets your drink order. 

My personal favorites is the chicken tikka masala and chicken makhani. The veggie tikka masala is great too! The cheese pieces are always delightful. I suggest just loading your plate up with some rice and try a little bit of everything like me! The garlic naan is yummy! Warm and fresh! I always ask for seconds. The rice pudding is my favorite dessert! I had to get some to-go because it was so yummy! Service was great! Kept the naan and the water refilled before they ran out.

I will definitely come again!
